'Salem's Lot.label: 'Salem's Lot
'Salem's Lot.description: 'Salem's Lot is a 1975 horror fiction novel written by the American author Stephen King. It was his second published novel. Wikipedia
Author: Stephen King

A Crown of Swords.label: A Crown of Swords
A Crown of Swords.description: A Crown of Swords is the seventh book of The Wheel of Time fantasy series written by American author Robert Jordan. It was published by Tor Books and released on May 15, 1996. A Crown of Swords consists of a prologue and 41 chapters. Wikipedia
Author: Robert Jordan

A Dance with Dragons.label: A Dance with Dragons
A Dance with Dragons.description: A Dance with Dragons is the fifth of seven planned novels in the epic fantasy series A Song of Ice and Fire by American author George R. R. Martin. Wikipedia
Author: George R. R. Martin

A Descent into the Maelström.label: A Descent into the Maelström
A Descent into the Maelström.description: "A Descent into the Maelström" is an 1841 short story by Edgar Allan Poe. In the tale, a man recounts how he survived a shipwreck and a whirlpool. Wikipedia
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

A Drama in Mexico.label: A Drama in Mexico
A Drama in Mexico.description: "A Drama in Mexico" is a historical short story by Jules Verne, first published in July 1851 under the title "The First Ships of the Mexican Navy". Wikipedia
Author: Jules Verne

A Drama in Livonia.label: A Drama in Livonia
A Drama in Livonia.description: A Drama in Livonia is a novel written by Jules Verne in 1893, revised in 1903 and first published in 1904. Wikipedia
Author: Jules Verne

A Few Good Men (play).label: A Few Good Men
A Few Good Men (play).description: A Few Good Men is a play by Aaron Sorkin, first produced on Broadway by David Brown in 1989. It tells the story of military lawyers at a court-martial who uncover a high-level conspiracy in the course ... Wikipedia

A Guide to the Project Management Body o.label: A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge
A Guide to the Project Management Body o.description: A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge is a book which presents a set of standard terminology and guidelines for project management. The Fifth Edition is the document resulting from work overseen by the Project Management Institute. Wikipedia

A Hero of Our Time.label: A Hero of Our Time
A Hero of Our Time.description: A Hero of Our Time is a novel by Mikhail Lermontov, written in 1839 and revised in 1841. It is an example of the superfluous man novel, noted for its compelling Byronic hero Pechorin and for the beautiful descriptions of the Caucasus. Wikipedia
Author: Mikhail Lermontov

A Journal of the Plague Year.label: A Journal of the Plague Year
A Journal of the Plague Year.description:
A Journal of the Plague Year is a novel by Daniel Defoe, 1660-1731, first published in March 1722.
The novel is a fictionalised account of one man's experiences of the year 1665, in which the Great Plague struck the city of London. Wikipedia
Author: Daniel Defoe

A Man Called Horse (short story).label: A Man Called Horse
A Man Called Horse (short story).description: A Man Called Horse by Dorothy M. Johnson was originally published as a short story in Collier's magazine, January 7, 1950, and was reprinted in 1968 as a short story in her book Indian Country. Wikipedia
Author: Dorothy M. Johnson

A Man Without a Country.label: A Man Without a Country
A Man Without a Country.description: A Man Without a Country is an essay collection published in 2005 by the author Kurt Vonnegut. The extremely short essays that make up this book deal with topics ranging from the importance of humor, to ... Wikipedia
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

A People's History of the United States.label: A People's History of the United States
A People's History of the United States.description: A People's History of the United States is a 1980 non-fiction book by American historian and political scientist Howard Zinn. Wikipedia
Author: Howard Zinn

A Severed Head.label: A Severed Head
A Severed Head.description:
A Severed Head is a satirical, sometimes farcical 1961 novel by Iris Murdoch.
Primary themes include marriage, adultery, and incest within a group of civilised and educated people. Wikipedia

A Short History of Nearly Everything.label: A Short History of Nearly Everything
A Short History of Nearly Everything.description: A Short History of Nearly Everything by American author Bill Bryson is a popular science book that explains some areas of science, using a style of language which aims to be more accessible to the ... Wikipedia
Author: Bill Bryson

A Storm of Swords.label: A Storm of Swords
A Storm of Swords.description: A Storm of Swords is the third of seven planned novels in A Song of Ice and Fire, a fantasy series by American author George R. R. Martin. Wikipedia
Author: George R. R. Martin

A Study in Scarlet.label: A Study in Scarlet
A Study in Scarlet.description: A Study in Scarlet is a detective mystery novel written by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, introducing his new characters, "consulting detective" Sherlock Holmes and his friend and chronicler, Dr. John Watson, ... Wikipedia
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

A Widow for One Year.label: A Widow for One Year
A Widow for One Year.description:
A Widow for One Year is a 1998 bestselling work of fiction by John Irving, the ninth of his novels to be published.
The first section of the novel was made into the movie The Door in the Floor in 2004. Wikipedia
Author: John Irving

A fekete város.label: A fekete város
A fekete város.description: A fekete város is a Hungarian novel of Kálmán Mikszáth set in the town of Lőcse, today Levoča. It is based on real historical events, but the story and dialogue are fictional. Wikipedia
Author: Kálmán Mikszáth

Against the Fall of Night.label: Against the Fall of Night
Against the Fall of Night.description: Against the Fall of Night is a science fiction novel by British writer Arthur C. Clarke. Originally appearing in the November, 1948 issue of the magazine Startling Stories, it was first published in book form in 1953 by Gnome Press. Wikipedia
Author: Arthur C. Clarke

Agnes Grey.label: Agnes Grey
Agnes Grey.description: Agnes Grey is the debut novel of English author Anne Brontë, first published in December 1847, and republished in a second edition in 1850. The novel follows Agnes Grey, a governess, as she works in several bourgeois families. Wikipedia

Alice Adams (novel).label: Alice Adams
Alice Adams (novel).description: Alice Adams is a 1921 Pulitzer Prize-winning novel by Booth Tarkington. It was adapted as a film in 1923 by Rowland V. Lee and, more famously, in 1935 by George Stevens. Wikipedia
Author: Booth Tarkington

All the President's Men.label: All the President's Men
All the President's Men.description: Conspiracy film specialist Alan J. Pakula turned journalists Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein's best-selling account of their Watergate investigation into one of the hit films of Bicentennial year 1976. While researching a story about a botched 1972 burglary of Democratic Party headquarters at the Wa… Moretergate apartment complex, green Washington Post reporters/rivals Woodward (Robert Redford, who also exec produced) and Bernstein (Dustin Hoffman) stumble on a possible connection between the burglars and a White House staffer. With the circumspect approval of executive editor Ben Bradlee (Jason Robards), the pair digs deeper. Aided by a guilt-ridden turncoat bookkeeper (Jane Alexander) and the vital if cryptic guidance of Woodward's mystery source, Deep Throat (Hal Holbrook), Woodward and Bernstein follow the money all the way to the top of the Nixon administration. Despite Deep Throat's warnings that their lives are in danger, and the reluctance of older Post editors, Woodward and Bernstein are determined to get out the story of the crime and its presidential cover-up. Once Bradlee is convinced, the final teletype impassively taps out the historically explosive results.~ Lucia Bozzola, All Movie Guide
Awards: Academy Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role
Academy Award for Best Writing Adapted Screenplay
Academy Award for Best Production Design
Academy Award for Best Sound Mixing
National Board of Review Award for Best Film
National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Film
New York Film Critics Circle Award for Best Director
National Board of Review Award for Best Director
New York Film Critics Circle Award for Best Film
National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Supporting Actor
Writers Guild of America Award for Best Adapted DramaMore

An American Tragedy.label: An American Tragedy
An American Tragedy.description: An American Tragedy is a novel by the American writer Theodore Dreiser. Wikipedia
Author: Theodore Dreiser

Amphitryon (play).label: Amphitryon
Amphitryon (play).description: Amphitryon is a Latin play for the early Roman theatre by playwright Titus Maccius Plautus. It is Plautus’ only play on a mythological subject; he refers to it as a tragicomoedia in the prologue. Wikipedia

An Essay on the Principle of Population.label: An Essay on the Principle of Population
An Essay on the Principle of Population.description: The book An Essay on the Principle of Population was first published in 1798 under the alias Joseph Johnson., but the author was soon identified as Thomas Robert Malthus. Wikipedia
Author: Thomas Robert Malthus

Andromaque.label: Andromaque
Andromaque.description: Andromaque is a tragedy in five acts by the French playwright Jean Racine written in alexandrine verse. Wikipedia

Angels & Demons.label: Angels and Demons
Angels & Demons.description: Angels & Demons is a 2009 American mystery thriller directed by Ron Howard and based on Dan Brown's novel by the same name. As a film it is the sequel to the 2006 film, The Da Vinci Code, also directed by Ron Howard. Wikipedia

Anna Christie.label: Anna Christie
Anna Christie.description: Anna Christie is a play in four acts by Eugene O'Neill. It made its Broadway debut at the Vanderbilt Theatre on November 2, 1921. O'Neill received the 1922 Pulitzer Prize for Drama for this work. Wikipedia

Anne of Green Gables.label: Anne of Green Gables
Anne of Green Gables.description: Anne of Green Gables is a bestselling 1908 novel by Canadian author Lucy Maud Montgomery. Written as fiction for readers of all ages, the literary classic has been considered a children's novel since the mid-twentieth century. Wikipedia
Author: Lucy Maud Montgomery
Adaptations: Anne of Green Gables – The MusicalMore

Ardiente paciencia.label: Ardiente paciencia
Ardiente paciencia.description: Ardiente Paciencia, or El Cartero De Neruda, is a 1985 novel by Antonio Skármeta. The novel was published in the English market under the title The Postman. Wikipedia
Author: Antonio Skármeta

Ark Angel.label: Ark Angel
Ark Angel.description: Ark Angel is the sixth book in the Alex Rider series written by British author Anthony Horowitz. The book was released in the United Kingdom on April 1, 2005 and in the United States on April 20, 2006. Wikipedia
Author: Anthony Horowitz

Atala (novella).label: Atala*
Atala (novella).description: Atala is an early novella by François-René de Chateaubriand, first published on 12 germinal IX. The work, inspired by his travels in North America, had an immense impact on early Romanticism, and went through five editions in its first year. Wikipedia
Author: François-René de Chateaubriand

Atonement (novel).label: Atonement
Atonement (novel).description: Atonement is a British family saga novel written by author Ian McEwan and published in 2001. It is about understanding and responding to the need for atonement. Wikipedia
Author: Ian McEwan

Atop an Underwood: Early Stories and Oth.label: Atop an Underwood Early Stories and Other Writings
Atop an Underwood: Early Stories and Oth.description: Atop an Underwood Early Stories and Other Writings is an anthology of American Beat writer Jack Kerouac's early work, published by Viking Press in 1999. Wikipedia
Author: Jack Kerouac

Awful End.label: Awful End
Awful End.description:
Awful End is a 2000 children's novel by Philip Ardagh and the first book of the Eddie Dickens trilogy, which was followed by The Further Adventures of Eddie Dickens.
It was shortlisted for the 2002 Stockton Children's Book of the Year Award. Wikipedia
Author: Philip Ardagh

Baudolino.label: Baudolino
Baudolino.description:
Baudolino is a 2000 novel by Umberto Eco about the adventures of a young man named Baudolino in the known and mythical Christian world of the 12th century.
Baudolino was translated into English in 2001 by William Weaver. Wikipedia
Author: Umberto Eco
Preceded by: The Island of the Day Before

Before Night Falls.label: Before Night Falls
Before Night Falls.description: Before Night Falls is a 2000 American drama film directed by Julian Schnabel. The screenplay is based on the autobiography of the same name of Reinaldo Arenas, which was published in English in 1993. Wikipedia

Berlin Alexanderplatz.label: Berlin Alexanderplatz
Berlin Alexanderplatz.description: Berlin Alexanderplatz originally broadcast in 1980, is a 14-part West German television miniseries, adapted and directed by Rainer Werner Fassbinder from the Alfred Döblin novel of the same name, and ... Wikipedia

Berlingske.label: Berlingske
Berlingske.description: Berlingske, previously known as Berlingske Tidende, is a Danish national daily newspaper based in Copenhagen. First published on 3 January 1749, it is the oldest Danish newspaper still published and among the oldest newspapers in the world. Wikipedia

Between Planets.label: Between Planets
Between Planets.description: Between Planets is a science fiction novel by Robert A. Heinlein, originally serialized in Blue Book magazine in 1951 as "Planets in Combat". It was published in hardcover that year by Scribner's as part of the Heinlein juveniles. Wikipedia
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Billy Budd.label: Billy Budd
Billy Budd.description: Billy Budd, Sailor is a novella begun in November 1888 by American author Herman Melville, left unfinished at his death in 1891, and published in 1924. Wikipedia

Black Robe.label: Black Robe
Black Robe.description: Black Robe is a 1991 film directed by Bruce Beresford. The screenplay was written by Irish Canadian author Brian Moore, who adapted it from his novel of the same name. Wikipedia
Awards: Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Motion Picture
Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role
Genie Award for Best Achievement in Art Direction/Production Design
Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Achievement in Cinematography
Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Achievement in Direction

Bobos in Paradise.label: Bobos in Paradise The New Upper Class and How They Got There
Bobos in Paradise.description: Bobos in Paradise The New Upper Class and How They Got There, ISBN 0-684-85378-7, is a book by David Brooks, first published in 2000. Wikipedia
Author: David Brooks
Followed by: On Paradise Drive How We Live Now (And Always Have) in the Future Tense

Bored of the Rings.label: Bored of the Rings
Bored of the Rings.description: Bored of the Rings is the title of a paperback parody of J. R. R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings. This short novel was written by Henry N. Beard and Douglas C. Kenney, who later founded National Lampoon. Wikipedia

Bug-Jargal.label: Bug-Jargal
Bug-Jargal.description: Bug-Jargal is a novel by the French writer Victor Hugo. First published in 1826, it is a reworked version of an earlier short story of the same name published in the Hugo brothers' magazine Le Conservateur littéraire in 1820. Wikipedia
Author: Victor Hugo

Busman's Honeymoon.label: Busman's Honeymoon
Busman's Honeymoon.description: Busman's Honeymoon is a 1937 novel by Dorothy L. Sayers, her eleventh featuring Lord Peter Wimsey. It is the fourth and last novel to feature Harriet Vane. Wikipedia
Followed by: In the Teeth of the Evidence

Carrie (novel).label: Carrie
Carrie (novel).description: Carrie is an American epistolary novel and author Stephen King's first published novel, released on April 5, 1974, with an approximate first print-run of 30,000 copies. Wikipedia
Author: Stephen King

Castle Rackrent.label: Castle Rackrent
Castle Rackrent.description: Castle Rackrent, a short novel by Maria Edgeworth published in 1800, is often regarded as the first historical novel, the first regional novel in English, the first Anglo-Irish novel, the first Big House novel and the first saga novel. Wikipedia
Author: Maria Edgeworth

Chain of Attack.label: Chain of Attack
Chain of Attack.description: Chain of Attack is a Star Trek The Original Series novel written by Gene DeWeese. Wikipedia
Author: Gene DeWeese

Chasm City.label: Chasm City
Chasm City.description: Chasm City is a 2001 science fiction novel by author Alastair Reynolds, set in the Revelation Space universe. Wikipedia
Author: Alastair Reynolds

Citizen of the Galaxy.label: Citizen of the Galaxy
Citizen of the Galaxy.description: Citizen of the Galaxy is a science fiction novel by American writer Robert A. Heinlein, originally serialized in Astounding Science Fiction and published in hardcover in 1957 as one of the Heinlein juveniles by Scribner's. Wikipedia
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

City of the Beasts.label: City of the Beasts
City of the Beasts.description: City of the Beasts is the first young adult novel by Chilean-American writer Isabel Allende, whose first cousin once removed is Salvador Allende, a former president of Chile. Published in 2002, the story is set in the Amazon rainforest. Wikipedia
Author: Isabel Allende

Clear and Present Danger.label: Clear and Present Danger
Clear and Present Danger.description: Clear and Present Danger is a 1994 spy thriller film directed by Phillip Noyce, based on Tom Clancy's book of the same name. Wikipedia

Cloud Atlas (novel).label: Cloud Atlas
Cloud Atlas (novel).description: Cloud Atlas is a 2004 novel, the third book by British author David Mitchell. It consists of six nested stories that take the reader from the remote South Pacific in the nineteenth century to a distant, post-apocalyptic future. Wikipedia
Author: David Mitchell

Clouds of Witness.label: Clouds of Witness
Clouds of Witness.description:
Clouds of Witness is a 1926 novel by Dorothy L. Sayers, the second in her series featuring Lord Peter Wimsey.
It was adapted for television in 1972, as part of a series starring Ian Carmichael as Lord Peter. Wikipedia
Author: Dorothy L. Sayers

Cold Mountain (novel).label: Cold Mountain
Cold Mountain (novel).description: Cold Mountain is a 1997 historical novel by Charles Frazier which won the U.S. National Book Award for Fiction. It tells the story of W. P. Wikipedia
Author: Charles Frazier

Consciousness Explained.label: Consciousness Explained
Consciousness Explained.description: Consciousness Explained is a 1991 book by the American philosopher Daniel Dennett which offers an account of how consciousness arises from interaction of physical and cognitive processes in the brain. Wikipedia
Author: Daniel Dennett

Cool Gardens.label: Cool Gardens
Cool Gardens.description: Cool Gardens is a poetry book by the lead singer of the band System of a Down, Serj Tankian. It was published by MTV Books and was released on October 1, 2002. Wikipedia
Author: Serj Tankian

Coot Club.label: Coot Club
Coot Club.description: Coot Club is the fifth book of Arthur Ransome's Swallows and Amazons series of children's books, published in 1934. Wikipedia
Author: Arthur Ransome

Cosmicomics.label: Cosmicomics
Cosmicomics.description: Cosmicomics is a book of short stories by Italo Calvino first published in Italian in 1965 and in English in 1968. Each story takes a scientific "fact", and builds an imaginative story around it. Wikipedia
Author: Italo Calvino

Count Zero.label: Count Zero
Count Zero.description: Count Zero is a science fiction novel written by William Gibson, originally published 1986. It is the second volume of the Sprawl trilogy, which begins with Neuromancer and concludes with Mona Lisa ... Wikipedia
Author: William Gibson

Creatures of Light and Darkness.label: Creatures of Light and Darkness
Creatures of Light and Darkness.description: Creatures of Light and Darkness is a 1969 science fiction novel by Roger Zelazny. Long out of print, it was reissued in April 2010. Wikipedia
Author: Roger Zelazny

Curtain (novel).label: Curtain
Curtain (novel).description: Curtain Poirot's Last Case is a work of detective fiction by Agatha Christie and first published in the UK by the Collins Crime Club in September 1975 and in the US by Dodd, Mead and Company later in the same year, selling for $7.95. Wikipedia
Author: Agatha Christie

Daughter of Fortune.label: Daughter of Fortune
Daughter of Fortune.description: Daughter of Fortune is a novel by Isabel Allende, and was chosen as an Oprah's Book Club selection in February 2000. Wikipedia
Author: Isabel Allende

Daughters of the Moon.label: Daughters of the Moon
Daughters of the Moon.description: Daughters of the Moon is a novel series by Lynne Ewing. It is about four fictional girls, later five, who are mortal goddesses and fight an ancient evil called The Atrox. They each have different powers, destinies, and dark sides. Wikipedia
Author: Lynne Ewing
Books: Daughters of the Moon - The Final Eclipse
Daughters of the Moon - The Becoming
Daughters of the Moon - The Lost One
Daughters of the Moon - The ChoiceMore

De nakomer.label: De nakomer
De nakomer.description: De nakomer is a novel by Dutch author Maarten 't Hart. It was first published in 1996. Wikipedia
Author: Maarten 't Hart

De re metallica.label: De Re Metallica
De re metallica.description: De re metallica is a book cataloguing the state of the art of mining, refining, and smelting metals, published a year posthumously in 1556 due to a delay in preparing woodcuts for the text. Wikipedia
Author: Georgius Agricola

Dead Souls.label: Dead Souls
Dead Souls.description: Dead Souls is a novel by Nikolai Gogol, first published in 1842, and widely regarded as an exemplar of 19th-century Russian literature. The purpose of the novel was to demonstrate the flaws and faults of the Russian mentality and character. Wikipedia
Author: Nikolai Gogol

Dexter in the Dark.label: Dexter in the Dark
Dexter in the Dark.description: Dexter in the Dark is a 2007 novel written by Jeff Lindsay. This is the third book in the Dexter series, preceded by the 2004 novel Darkly Dreaming Dexter—which formed the basis of the Showtime television ... Wikipedia
Author: Jeff Lindsay

Dictionary of American Naval Fighting Sh.label: Dictionary of American Naval Fighting Ships
Dictionary of American Naval Fighting Sh.description: The Dictionary of American Naval Fighting Ships is the official reference work for the basic facts about ships used by the United States Navy. Wikipedia

Dialectic of Enlightenment.label: Dialectic of Enlightenment
Dialectic of Enlightenment.description: Dialectic of Enlightenment is a work of philosophy and social criticism written by Frankfurt School philosophers Max Horkheimer and Theodor W. Adorno and first published in 1944. Wikipedia

Dictionary of the Khazars.label: Dictionary of the Khazars
Dictionary of the Khazars.description: Dictionary of the Khazars A Lexicon Novel is the first novel by Serbian writer Milorad Pavić, published in 1984. Originally written in Serbian, the novel has been translated into many languages. Wikipedia
Author: Milorad Pavić

Die Feuerzangenbowle.label: Die Feuerzangenbowle
Die Feuerzangenbowle.description: Die Feuerzangenbowle is a 1944 German film, directed by Helmut Weiss and is based on the book of the same name. It follows the book closely as its author, Heinrich Spoerl, also wrote the script for the movie. Wikipedia

Different Seasons.label: Different Seasons
Different Seasons.description: Different Seasons is a collection of four Stephen King novellas with a more serious dramatic bent than the horror fiction for which King is famous. The four novellas are tied together via subtitles that relate to each of the four seasons. Wikipedia
Author: Stephen King
